newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Ayala Land falls 3.85 pct in mid-trade.
newsitem.headline: Ayala Land falls 3.85 pct in mid-trade.

text.p: Property firm Ayala Land shed one peso, or 3.85 percent, to 25 pesos at mid-session on Monday due to negative sentiment towards the property sector combined with fears of a U.S. interest rate hike, brokers said.

"The real estate sector is sensitive to the interest rate hike issue. The developer has to borrow money and they get hit once interest rates are raised," said Noel Reyes, research head at Anscor-Hagedorn Securities.
Index-linked Ayala Land was the third most heavily traded stock at mid-session on Monday. Manila's main index was sharply down by 53.79 points, or 1.81 percent, at 2,922.99 points.

Sun Hung Kai Securities vice-president for research Raul Ruiz said recurring fears of a glut in the property sector along with fears of a possible rise in interest rates were pulling down Ayala Land's price.
The Philippine Stock Exchange property sector sub-index was down by 35.55 points, or 2.51 percent, at 1,382.38 points.
